messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/4/2003 10:40:45 AM Eastern Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:


> << My son is a certified
> railroad fiend and I'm seeking detailed information on being an
> engineer, like when and where do they eat, where do they sleep when
> they're away from home. I like to tell them stories and I don't have
> enough details to fill in the engineer one. >>

I posted this separately to Diane, but Sharon of the Swamp was the poster
with an engineer/railroad worker for a husband. I've forwarded the info on to
Sharon.

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Railroad engineer
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/3/03 10:41:48 PM, cen46624@vol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/3/03 10:41:48 PM, cen46624@... writes:

<< My son is a certified
railroad fiend and I'm seeking detailed information on being an
engineer, like when and where do they eat, where do they sleep when
they're away from home. I like to tell them stories and I don't have
enough details to fill in the engineer one. >>

A friend of mine drove trains here for a while. He would go from Albuquerque
to Gallup and back, so he slept at home. Someone from Arizona would go from
his house to Gallup and then back, so neither of the routes was the whole
distance.

Sandra

messages.subject: Railroad engineer
messages.msgSnippet: Hi! Someone who is or used to be on this group has a husband who s a railroad engineer. Would you let me know?  My son is a certified railroad fiend and I m
messages.messageBody:
Hi!

Someone who is or used to be on this group has a husband who's a
railroad engineer. Would you let me know? My son is a certified
railroad fiend and I'm seeking detailed information on being an
engineer, like when and where do they eat, where do they sleep when
they're away from home. I like to tell them stories and I don't have
enough details to fill in the engineer one.

We could also talk on the phone--email me, please!

:-) Diane
